title: Jack Black Toasts โBobโs Burgersโ 300th Episode in Animated โGrease and Fearโ-Fueled MusicยVideo
summary: Season 16 of Bob's Burgers premieres Sunday night at 9:30 p.m. ET on FOX and streaming next day on Hulu.
body: With 14 years and 15 seasons under its white apron, Bob’s Burgers is kicking off season 16 on Sunday night with its landmark 300th episode — and Jack Black is helping mark the occasion with an epic new music video, premiering exclusively on Billboard below. The “Grease and Fear” music video opens with a chorus of hamburgers, singing a cascading harmony of la-la-la’s, before a power chord kicks in and a caped frontman is revealed among a band dressed in burger costumes. That frontman? The inimitable Jack Black, who, even in animated form, is instantly recognizable with his bushy gray-striped beard and jigging dance moves. Related The National Drop New ‘Bob’s Burgers’ Thanksgiving Song: ‘Save The Bird’ ‘Bob’s Burgers’ Creator Loren Bouchard on Epic 107-Song Album: ‘It’s About Time’ How to Secure Last-Minute Tickets to Global Citizen Festival 2025 “There was once a man who dreamed a dream, a dream of burgers/ Beef, tomatoes, lettuce and some buns,” Black begins the dramatic song. “But sometimes dreaming burger dreams and dreams of burgers/ Can make a burger dreaโฆ

title: Public transport navigation in Google Maps just got a much-needed overhaul
summary: You can finally explore Google Maps without ending your transit trip.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority TL;DR Google Maps has updated its public transit navigation to allow full map access during trips. Users can now search, browse, and reroute without cancelling or restarting their current journey. Plus, new walking directions feature includes pedestrian incident reporting like crashes or slowdowns. Google Maps walking and transit guidance has been pretty abysmal for years now. People like me, who donโt own a car and rely on their feet and public transport, have had to accept a subpar experience that doesnโt come anywhere near driving directions, with no easy way to check out Maps without leaving the ongoing trip. Now, Maps is rolling out an update that brings a big change to public transit navigation, and I noticed it yesterday on my phone as I was zooming through Paris to get to a theatre. Let me walk you through the changes. Transit navigation no longer locks out the rest of Maps My biggest pet peeve when using public transit directions on Google Maps is how inflexible this used to be. Start navigation, and there was no way to rethink or adjust routes mid-trip if there was an unexpected delay or incident, or if I had to change my destinโฆ

title: Looking for a great free Android game? Check out this 90s pinball gem
summary: Windows 95 called and it wants its Space Cadet pinball game back.
body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority A few weeks ago, I was catching up on an older episode of the Android Faithful podcast when host Ron Richards mentioned a new Android game thatโd been ported from Windows by an indie dev โ the famous 3D Pinball Space Cadet. A few hours later, as I was browsing Twitter/X, I came across a viral post by one of the developers who worked on the original Space Cadet Windows port from the original Full Tilt! Pinball title. It felt like a sign that I should break my no-games-on-my-phone rule and install this oldie but goodie. I grabbed the Space Cadet Pinball APK , installed it, and was immediately taken back in time to 1999, sitting in front of my first PC, starting Windows 98, and discovering it came with a few games pre-installed. 3D Pinball Space Cadet was one of those games, and it quickly became my go-to time-waster during school holidays and on weekends. Now, more than 25 years later, would I still like it?

title: Google Search Live is out of beta and ready to help you make matcha
summary: Real-time multimodal AI is hitting the Google app.
body: TL;DR Googleโs new Search Live feature is rolling out to English-language users in the US. Search Live allows for real-time multimodal exchanges with Google AI. The feature was initially previewed in beta in June. Google introduced Search Live , a new addition to its AI Mode search functionality, back in June. It works a lot like Gemini Live, facilitating an interaction that mimics a back-and-forth conversation with Google, but with a twist: Search Live also incorporates your camera feed, letting you ask questions about the world around you. Until today, Search Live has been an opt-in Labs feature. But now, itโs available much more broadly. Starting today, Google says that Search Live is out of beta in the US. English-language users on can now have a real-time exchange with AI Mode inside the Google app, without having to opt in or download any additional applications.
